definitions.definition: either of the two soft edges at the opening to the mouth
definitions.labels: (informal)(formal)(British English)(British English)(disapproving)(both informal, often disapproving)(informal, disapproving)

examples.text: The assistant **pursed her lips**.
your **upper/lower/top/bottom lip**
She kissed him on the lips.
He raised the bottle to his lips and took a large swig from it.
He bit his lip nervously, trying not to cry.
Her lips curled contemptuously.
He licked his lips hungrily.
She has full, pouty lips.
He nervously moistened his lips with his tongue.
She wiped her lips with the back of her hand.
His lips brushed her cheek.
Their lips met and the kiss was soft.
There was a slight smile on her lips.

definitions.definition: having the type of lips mentioned

examples.text: thin-lipped
thick-lipped

definitions.definition: the edge of a container or a hollow place in the ground

examples.text: He ran his finger around the lip of the cup.
Lava bubbled a few feet below the lip of the crater.

definitions.definition: words spoken to somebody that are rude and show a lack of respect for that person

examples.text: Don't let him **give you** any **lip**!
I’ve just about had enough of your lip!

definitions.definition: to stop yourself from saying something or from showing an emotion

examples.text: I bit my lip and forced myself to be calm.

definitions.definition: to move your tongue over your lips, especially before eating something good
to show that you are excited about something and want it to happen soon

examples.text: They were licking their lips at the thought of clinching the deal.

definitions.definition: used to say that you will not repeat somebody’s secret to other people
if words do not pass your lips, you say nothing
if food or drink does not pass your lips, you eat or drink nothing
if something is on everyone’s lips, they are all talking about it
used to tell somebody to listen carefully to what you are saying

examples.text: Read my lips: no new taxes *(= I promise there will be no new taxes)*.

definitions.definition: to move your lips, apart noisily, especially before eating something good
to show that you are excited about something and want it to happen soon

examples.text: They were smacking their lips at the thought of clinching the deal.

definitions.definition: to keep calm and hide your feelings when you are in pain or in a difficult situation

examples.text: He was taught to keep a stiff upper lip and never to cry in public.
Their reaction contrasts sharply with the stiff upper lip of the English.

definitions.definition: nothing is completely certain until it really happens because things can easily go wrong

wordOrigin: Old English lippa, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch lip and German Lippe, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin labia, labra ‘lips’.
